sen.j: 近江神宮（おうみじんぐう）は、滋賀県大津市に鎮座する神社。
sen.e: Omi-jingu Shrine is the shrine which sits majestically in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
Omi-jingu Shrine is a shrine which sits majestically atop Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
Omi-jingu Shrine is a shrine which sits majestically atop Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 紀元二千六百年記念行事にあたる昭和15年（1940年）に鎮座した、新しい神社である。
sen.e: It is a new shrine that was built in 1940, when 2600th anniversary of the Imperial history was held.
It is a new shrine that was built in 1940, during celebrations of the 2600th anniversary of the Imperial history.
It is a new shrine that was built in 1940, during celebrations of the 2600th anniversary of the Imperial history.

sen.j: 667年に飛鳥から当地へ近江京として遷都した由緒に因み、遷都を行った天智天皇を祭神として設営された。
sen.e: The shrine was arranged to provide Emperor Tenchi as its enshrined deity, because the Emperor transferred the capital from Asuka to Omi-kyo in A.D. 667.
The shrine was arranged to provide Emperor Tenchi as its enshrined deity, because the Emperor transferred the capital from Asuka to Omi-kyo in A.D. 667.
The shrine was arranged to provide Emperor Tenchi as its enshrined deity, because the Emperor transferred the capital from Asuka to Omi-kyo in A.D. 667.

sen.j: 社殿は「近江造」と呼ばれる独特のもので、国の登録有形文化財として登録されている。
sen.e: Its sanctuary, the main building of Omi-jingu Shrine, is one of the registered tangible cultural assets of Japan, which has a distinctive building style that is called "Omi-zukuri."
sen.cmt: 定訳のCultural propertiesとCultural assetsではassetsのほうがより適切な訳だと思います。
sen.e: Its sanctuary, the main building of Omi-jingu Shrine, is one of the registered tangible cultural assets of Japan, which has a distinctive architectural style that is called "Omi-zukuri."
Its sanctuary, the main building of Omi-jingu Shrine, is one of the registered tangible cultural assets of Japan, which has a distinctive architectural style that is called 'Omi-zukuri.'

sen.j: 境内には各地の時計業者が寄進した日時計や漏刻などを飾ってあり時計博物館が併設されている。
sen.e: Sun clocks and rokoku (water clocks) which were donated by clock merchants from various places are displayed in the precincts of the shrine; the clock museum is located next to the shrine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Sun clocks and rokoku (water clocks) which were donated by clock merchants from various places are displayed in the precincts of the shrine; the clock museum is located next to the shrine.
Sun clocks and rokoku (water clocks) which were donated by clock merchants from various places are displayed in the precincts of the shrine; the clock museum is located next to the shrine.

sen.j: これらは、天智天皇が日本で初めて水時計（漏刻）を設置した歴史に由来する。
sen.e: These arrangements are derived from the tradition that Emperor Tenchi placed a rokoku in the shrine for the first time in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: These arrangements are derived from the tradition that Emperor Tenchi placed a rokoku in the shrine for the first time in Japan.
These arrangements are derived from the tradition that Emperor Tenchi placed a rokoku in the shrine for the first time in Japan.

sen.j: また、競技かるたのチャンピオンを決める名人・クイーンが毎年1月にここで行われている。
sen.e: The competition of Kyogi Karuta (one-on-one card game) is held in the shrine in January every year, in which a male champion on the male competition is awarded the title Master and a female champion on the female competition is awarded the title Queen.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。小倉百人一首の一首目http://news.livedoor.com/article/detail/1406776/, 近江神宮名人・クィーン位http://www.gaido.jp/clickalbum/detail.php?ID=62&gaido_code=2
sen.e: The competition of Kyogi Karuta (one-on-one card game) is held in the shrine in January every year, in which a male champion from the male competition is awarded the title Master and a female champion from the female competition is awarded the title Queen.

The competition of Kyogi Karuta (one-on-one card game) is held in the shrine in January every year, in which a male champion from the male competition is awarded the title Master and a female champion from the female competition is awarded the title Queen.

sen.j: この大会は、小倉百人一首の一首目の歌を詠んだ天智天皇にちなむ。
sen.e: These competitions are associated with Emperor Tenchi who wrote the poem that appears first in the poem collections, "Ogura Hyakunin Isshu" ("The Ogura's Sequence of One Hundred Poems by One Hundred Poets").
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: These competitions are associated with Emperor Tenchi who wrote the poem that appears first in the poem collection, "Ogura Hyakunin Isshu" ("The Ogura's Sequence of One Hundred Poems by One Hundred Poets").

These competitions are associated with Emperor Tenchi who wrote the poem that appears first in the poem collection, "Ogura Hyakunin Isshu" (The Ogura's Sequence of One Hundred Poems by One Hundred Poets).

National Treasures
National Treasures

sen.j: 崇福寺塔心礎納置品 一括 - 京都国立博物館に寄託。
sen.e: The set of objects which were stored in the central base stone in Sofuku-ji Temple is now deposited to Kyoto National Museum.
The set of objects which were stored in the central base stone in Sofuku-ji Temple is now placed in safe keeping at the Kyoto National Museum.
The set of objects which were stored in the central base stone in Sofuku-ji Temple is now placed in safe keeping at the Kyoto National Museum.

sen.j: 紙本墨画淡彩楼閣山水図 六曲屏風一双 曾我蕭白筆
sen.e: "Rokaku Sansui-zu" (Landscape of High Buildings) on a pair of six-panel folding screens, ink and light-colored painting on paper, painted by Shohaku SOGA

sen.j: 時計博物館
sen.e: Omi Jingu Shrine Clock Museum
Omi Jingu Shrine Clock Museum
Omi Jingu Shrine Clock Museum

sen.j: 世界の時計約3000点を集めた県下唯一の時計博物館。
sen.e: Omi Jingu Shrine Clock Museum has large collections of clocks which consist of approximately 3000 items from all over the world and it is the only clock museum in the prefecture.
Omi Jingu Shrine Clock Museum has a large collections of clocks which consist of approximately 3000 items from all over the world and it is the only clock museum in the prefecture.
Omi Jingu Shrine Clock Museum has a large collections of clocks which consist of approximately 3000 items from all over the world and it is the only clock museum in the prefecture.

sen.j: 参拝客用の休憩所2階にある。
sen.e: It is located on the second floor of the Visitors' Rest House.
sen.cmt: 原文意味不明。事実と異なる。時計博物館は別の建物にリニューアルされている。http://oumijingu.org/
sen.e: It is located on the second floor of the Visitors' Rest House.
It is located on the second floor of the Visitors' Rest House.

sen.j: 天智天皇が日本で初めての時計である漏刻を設置した経緯から、1963年(昭和38年)に時計博物館が作られた。
sen.e: The clock museum was placed in the shrine in 1963, because Emperor Tenchi was the first person to use a clock in Japan; the clock was a "rokoku."
The clock museum was placed in the shrine in 1963, because Emperor Tenchi was the first person to use a clock in Japan; the clock was a "rokoku."
The clock museum was placed in the shrine in 1963, because Emperor Tenchi was the first person to use a clock in Japan; the clock was a rokoku.

sen.j: 日本最古の時計である漏刻の復元模型や中国で使われていた火時計の復元模型が屋外に展示されており、また日時計や和時計といった貴重な実物の時計を数多く展示している。
sen.e: There are some restored models of clocks displayed outside: the model of the water clock which was the oldest clock of Japan: the one of the fire clock which was used in China; and also there are a lot of valuable genuine clocks, such as sun clocks and Japanese clocks, displayed inside.

There are some restored models of clocks displayed outside: the model of the water clock which was the oldest clock of Japan: a fire clock which was used in China; and many valuable genuine clocks, such as sun clocks and Japanese clocks, displayed inside.

There are some restored models of clocks displayed outside: the model of the water clock which was the oldest clock of Japan: a fire clock which was used in China; and many valuable genuine clocks, such as sun clocks and Japanese clocks, displayed inside.

sen.j: 入場料：大人300円、小人150円
sen.e: Admission fees: 300 yen for Adults, 150 yen for Children
Admission fees: 300 yen for Adults, 150 yen for Children
Admission fees: 300 yen for Adults, 150 yen for Children

sen.j: 鉄道
sen.e: By train
By train
By train

sen.j: 京阪電気鉄道京阪石山坂本線 近江神宮前駅から北西へ0.6km。
sen.e: Take a train on Keihan Electric Railway Keihan Ishiyama Sakamoto Line, get off at Omi-jinja-Mae Station and walk north west for 0.6 km.
Take a train on Keihan Electric Railway Keihan Ishiyama Sakamoto Line, get off at Omi-jinja-Mae Station and walk north west for 0.6 km.
Take a train on Keihan Electric Railway Keihan Ishiyama Sakamoto Line, get off at Omi-jinja-Mae Station and walk north west for 0.6 km.

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道湖西線 大津京駅から北西へ1.1km。
sen.e: Or take a train on JR-West (West Japan Railway Company) Kosei Railway Line, get off at Otsukyo Station and walk north west for 1.1km.
Or take a train on JR-West (West Japan Railway Company) Kosei Railway Line, get off at Otsukyo Station and walk north west for 1.1km.

sen.j: 琵琶湖西縦貫道路 南志賀ランプから南へ0.4km。
sen.e: Take Biwako nishi jukan road, get off at Miami-Shiga Ramp, and go south for 0.4 km.
